videos.title: 3 Prom Hairstyles | Updo | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
It's springtime and nearly Prom season which means girls all around the world are watching prom vlogs, prom makeup tutorials, and prom grwm videos frantically trying to decide which prom hairstyles, prom dress, and prom makeup to wear!   Have you finished your prom get ready with me plans? Or finished your last minute prom dress shopping? Or if your early in the prom season for your school have you decided on your promposal?  

Have no fear because this video is about to show you 3 Prom Hairstyles that are all adorable, would look great with any prom dress, and are still an easy DIY.   You won't even need mom to schedule a hairdresser appointment or beg your best friend to do it! 
The first style is two basic fishtails that are knotted together and then bobby pinned in place.  Add some gorgeous curls and you are set to go.  

The second prom hairstyle is created by taking two dutch braids from either side of the head and wrapping them around a low braided bun.  This prom hairstyle will keep your shoulders cooler and keep you from sweating too much as your dancing the night away. 

The third style is a faux braid.  That's right!  A faux braid!  You don't even need to know how to do a simple three strand braid as this just uses two strands and a series of elastics to create this gorgeous side braid.  Pair this hairstyle with a less fancy dress to add some pop and get everyone talking about your hair! 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGH3PromStyles

videos.title: Side Pull Thru Braid Combo | Prom Hairstyles | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
This #CGHSidePullThruCombo is such a fun hairstyle and great for many uses.  You can wear this easy DIY hairstyle as an everyday hairstyle to work or to school.  Or you can wear this DIY hairstyle for something fancy like prom!  

I love side fishtail braids and I especially love pull thru braids.  This great hairstyle combines the two and adds a twist to make it a fancy updo or a casual relaxed look!

To begin create a side fishtail on one side of the head.  Secure this with bobby pins.  Now add a twist from each side and secure directly under the fishtail braid.  

Use the remaining hair to create two sections and begin a pull thru braid using elastics.  Pancake the hair to add extra volume and beauty.  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHSidePullThruCombo

videos.title: Side Triple Flower | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Today's video is great as it is a simple and easy hairstyle for beginners.  You can do this easy hairstyle for long hair or as an easy hairstyle for medium hair.  I've used this braided bun hairstyle on myself as an easy DIY hairstyle or on my daughters!  My daughters have even done this hairstyle on each other since it's an easy hairstyle for kids to do!
What makes this hairstyle simple is that you only need to know how to do a regular braid in order to create the great side braid look.  As this hairstyle is so easy, it is also quick which means that you can use this hairstyle as a great go-to for an easy hairstyle for school. 

To begin this hairstyle you need to part off one small section of hair next to the ear.  Then divide this section into three smaller sections.  Pin two of the sections out of the way.  

With the free section of hair, begin a simple braid.  When you have the braid completed gently tug on one side of the braid to pop the edge of the braid outward.  Secure the braid with an elastic leaving the ends in the elastic to create a loop.  Use the loop and begin to roll the braid up into a bun.  

Secure the bun against the head with bobby pins.  Repeat these steps with the other two braids to create a triangle shape of rosette looking buns.  
This easy hairstyle for girls is sure to impress and would love fabulous in so many settings!  Prepare for compliments!  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHSideTripleFlower

videos.title: 3 Easy Headband Hairstyles | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
I love winter because it makes throwing on a hat or a headband so easy and simple in the mornings.  In this video I will show you three simply and easy hairstyles for wearing headbands.  Pair any of these hairstyles with a cute sweater or jacket and you are ready for the day!

The first headband hairstyle is a darling bun wrapped with a braid.  This easy hairstyle still has a sophisticated look to it that you can wear to work or other dressier events.  

The second headband hairstyle is two stacked fishtails.  I love this style for a soft, boho feel that will work with any soft, knit headband.  If you don't want to stack the braids simply do two fishtails for a similar effect.  

The third hairstyle is a cute sporty pull thru ponytail.  Add a headband and you will be ready for any winter sporting events, a day on the ski slopes, or a fun day out and about.  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGH3HeadbandStyles

videos.title: Side Swept Fishtail Updo | Holiday Hairstyle | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Are you as excited about the upcoming holiday season as I am?  The holidays mean delicious holiday food, lots of relaxation, and tons of family/friend holiday parties.  

Of course during the holiday parties you want to look your best so today I am showing you how to do this amazing Side Swept Fishtail Updo holiday hairstyle.  

In this holiday hairstyle tutorial you will learn how to create a fishtail braid on the side of your head. You then create the holiday hair by bobby pinning the fishtail back, creating another basic braid underneath and sweeping the whole hairstyle to the side. videos.title: Side Elastic Braid | DIY Hairstyles | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Whether you're looking for a homecoming hairstyle or an everyday look, this side elastic braid is one of my absolute favorite hairstyles! This DIY hairstyle may look complicated, but in reality it is super simple and quick to do! You will love this look for a prom hairstyle, a holiday party hairstyle, or even a romantic beach hairstyle look  

To recreate this DIY hairstyle tutorial you begin by creating a lace braid on the side of the head near the temple.  Only adding hair into the one side of the braid.  Then I go back and pancake the hair to add fullness and fluff.  

Once the lace braid is secure then I take the lace braid and another small piece of hair from the other side.  Secure them together.  

From this point on you just need to take one piece of hair from each side, twist the hair, and then secure them with an elastic.  Go back and tug on the hair to loosen the twists and make it look so pretty and full.  

The ease comes from you only needing to use a few elastics and twists.  But the braid itself looks so amazing and beautiful.  It looks like a fancy french braid or a fax french braid.  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHElasticBraid

This has to be one of the most beautiful fishtail braid hairstyles ever! I have been receiving requests on FB, Twitter, email, etc, for today's hairstyle from viewers everywhere. It has been likely our most requested hairstyle to date! You can understand why if you've seen many photos of this style floating around on Pinterest, Facebook, and Instagram.

There is nothing super new or special about the Split Fishtail, as the braid itself is exactly the same as our Box Fishtail from last year. It's the braiding technique you use, however, that's different. 

For a cute final look, simply pancake only the underside and you'll end up with a very beautiful braid look similar to our Stacked Braid tutorial from a few years back! This one has much more of a messy look to it, which I love!

To see your own photo recreations featured in our app, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle on IG with: #CGHMessySplitFishtail

As always, any fishtail braid will take you a while to complete. This one not super difficult, which is why we are categorizing it as "Easy", but do plan on spending about 8-10 minutes on the braid.

Enjoy!

videos.title: Katniss' Mockingjay Braid | Hunger Games Hairstyles
videos.description:
Click here to see more hairstyles from The Hunger Games movies: 
http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLC0E435779246B4E5
____________________

Many of you know that were are HUGE fans of The Hunger Games books and movie franchise! We've been friends with Linda Flowers, the Department Head of Hair & Makeup for both The Hunger Games and Catching Fire ever since we first put up the Katniss braid years ago. Since Linda had a contract for Dancing With The Stars, she was unable to work on the Mockingly movies, with Lionsgate instead hiring Camille Friend. Camille is just as talented, and her team did an amazing job trying to have the hair reflect the mood of the war-trodden State, as in the book.

Katniss' braid in this 3rd movie isn't supposed to be focused so much on style, as her time in the Capitol and in the Games merited. This time around, Panem is at war, with a growing rebellion movement, and the look is supposed to fully reflect that. 

Things aren't as they once were, and that's why there is a fundamental change in the Katniss braid.

Katniss still wears a side braid, which as Linda told us is to ensure that she doesn't snag her braid as she removes arrows from the quiver on her back. This time around, the wrapping braids from the left and right are French braids instead of Katniss' signature Dutch braid. For the side braid, the stitching looks very similar to a Simple braid, however it really is a chunky Reverse Fishtail. The look is also supposed to be somewhat messy and disheveled, which is the look we were going for. {The wind and rain in our trailer video shoot certainly helped with that!}

To see your own photo recreations featured in our app, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle on IG with: #CGHMockingjayBraid

Hope you enjoyed this video, and if you did... please give it a big "Thumbs Up"! Be sure to join us next week for another Mockingjay hairstyle tutorial!

üíã's -Mindy

videos.title: How to Create a Double Dutchback | Heidi Klum Hairstyles
videos.description:
Have you visited our website http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com? We have about 20 more hairstyles on there from before our YouTube days!

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

My dad is so cute! You see, he is so proud of our family, our fans,  and what this CGH YouTube channel has accomplished! He's always texting or emailing us photos of hairstyles he sees when he is running errands, or watching TV!

Several weeks ago he emailed me a photo of a hairstyle worn by Heidi Klum, from America's Got Talent. In the email, he hinted that we "should seriously film a video of it"!

Dad, this one is for you!

The hairstyle consists of two Dutch braids on only one side of the head, that wrap down and underneath the back of the head, where they braids are tied off with an hair elastic.

This cute hairstyle provides an "edgy" look that would be perfect for competitive dance or cheer teams. {I can foresee several dance groups wearing this one, for sure!} 

This style can also be worn for several days, and looks adorable with straight, curly, or wavy hair! If you are careful with it, you can wear it for several days in a row, too!


Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHDoubleDutchback

It is another way to get the "shaved" without committing to a razor and half bald head! We've shave another single-sides-up style on the channel, and it was a popular one. You can see it here:

Side Flat Twists: http://youtu.be/I153MibXY2w

Please leave a comment below letting me know what TV shows you love where they show great hair! I'd like to know!

As always, don't forget to Like, Favorite, Comment, and SHARE!

One of the first tutorials we ever posted on our website nearly 5 years ago, was a Slide-Up Braid {aka Snake Braid} http://youtu.be/s2n5XkFh88A. That video has over 6,000,000 views today!
 
We have done a few variations of the Slide-Up Braid over the years, but this is a beautiful one because it is so subtle.  The purpose of a Sides Up style is to pull back your sides with another hairstyling accent and feature your natural or curly hair.  This style does just that.

By creating Slide-Up Braids on either side of the head, and pinning them back while covering the pins with your down hair, you are left with such a beautiful hairstyle!

Bailey wore this hairdo to her Christmas concert yesterday and received lots of compliments on it.  We are certain you will too, when you wear this!

Enjoy!

videos.description:

This past week, we were in Missouri on vacation {where we lived before our move to UT}, and my son went over to a friends house to play. When he came home, he had a bracelet woven by one of the boys that had tied it during a boy scout project.

It reminded me of the "boondoggles" that were tied by the supporting actress in the Napoleon Dynamite movie, and something similar that we used to tie when I was younger.  If it can be done on a boondoggle, then it can be done in a braid... right?

Here we show you how!  This braid has some tricky stranding, which is the only reason why we label it with "Medium" skill level.  Once you get it down, it really goes quite fast!

Enjoy!

xoxo
Mindy

videos.title: Lace-Up Braid | Cute Braided Hairstyles
videos.description:
Did you know you can follow us on Instagram? We will see you there! http://www.instagram.com/CuteGirlsHairstyles

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

Tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHLaceUpBraid

For this week's tutorial, we wanted to show you how to lace two simple braids together.  Why do we like this?  

Because some girls can spend 20+ minutes trying to get a 6-strand braid.  Using our cheat method here, you can get a similar look in only a few minutes!

Literally, you create two simple braids and then use one previously-excluded free strand to lace them together... just like lacing up boots!  Once you get the lacing down, you can tie together a 4+ strand braid, or any number of individual braids!

Try it and see how many comments you get!  When you tell your friends it only took just a few minutes, they won't believe you!

Feel free, if you liked this particular Lace Up Braid tutorial, to share it with two friends who you think will love it, too!  Thanks in advance!

xoxo

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 2 hair bands, 1 small hair elastic, and hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 3-5 minutes

Skill Level: Easy

videos.title: Waterfall into Double Frenchbacks | Sport Hairstyles
videos.description:
Tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHWaterDoubleFrench

If you have seen our Soccer Braids tutorial, I need to let you know that was my go-to hairstyle when I was a young girl.  For each of my girls, that is the very style we use when they are participating in sports because the hair held up well with all the activity.

Today, I wanted to dig into my past by taking that style and "spicing" it up a bit.  

Rather than adding another Frenchback down the middle, I opted to create a double-sided Waterfall Braid down the center of the head.  I then incorporated those fall-through strands as the added-in hair for the topside of each Frenchback.  It turned out super cute, and leaves a very intricate pattern that I am sure people will notice!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 2 small hair elastics, accessory or hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 8-10 minutes

Skill Level: Medium

videos.title: 2-Minute Faux Fishtail Braid | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Today's video features CGH#1 filming her very first tutorial!  She wanted to show all of you an easy hairstyle she does on herself in the mornings in "2 minutes or less".

This is called a Faux {Fake} Fishtail, and CGH#1 loves it because it looks like a fishtail braid... but you did not have to spend 20 minutes braiding it! 

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHFauxFishtailBraid

We have done triple and quadruple-flipped ponytails before, but they used several elastics.  This flipping technique is so cool, that you literally only need one elastic!  

Also, we present to you our four favorite names for our new family puppy... from the over 16,000 fan suggestions you left in our last video.  Our four favorites are Chewy {from Chewbacca in Star Wars}, Thor {because this little guy is so tough}, Mousse {play on words for a tough Moose and the mousse foam used in hair, and Braidy {play on words for Brady, the boy's name, and "Braid"y, since we are huge fans of braids!  

For the next week, are allowing our fans to vote for their favorite from among those four names, and we will announce the new puppy's name in our net video!  Be sure to comment below with your vote!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, 1 small hair elastic, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 1-2 minutes

Skill Level: Very Easy

To see step-by-step instructions and more photos of this style, please visit...

videos.description:
In this video, we show you first how to create a Feather Braid, and how to use one to create a super cute Ladder Braid.  This video will essentially be two tutorials in one!

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHLadderBraidPony

We have used this braiding technique for awhile, and some of my YouTube friends have great tutorials as well {Hair4myPrincess, GirlyDos, BabesInHairland, etc}.  This particular combination was inspired by a French YouTube beauty guru by the name of EnjoyPhoenix {http://www.youtube.com/EnjoyPhoenix}.

My girls are learning how to create this braid in their own hair, which is why we show you how to use it in a cute side braid.  They love it because it seems much more grown up than the simply ponytail version.  You will note that this braid has a similar fun look as a few of our other ponytail combos...

videos.title: Hair-Wrapped Rope Braid {Plait} | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Rope braids {or plaits} are one of the more simple hairstyles one can learn, because you do not need to know how to braid... it is made up only of twists!  They are very pretty, and can be done in just a few minutes!

We have not shown you how to do a basic rope braid before, although we did show you a French version of it a few months ago.  You can view it here:

French Twist into Rope Braid
http://youtu.be/KYc8rJe7kTo

My niece Aniston {age 13} slept over at our house with the twins last weekend and she begged and begged for me to film a hairstyle on her!  How could I resist?  She has such gorgeous blonde hair, so we tried a few styles on her and together we decided on this version of the rope braid!  

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHHairWrapRopeBraid

Since Aniston is a "hair newbie", she wanted us to show her a simple hairstyle that she will be able to do on her own hair when she is home.

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 1 large hairband, 1 small hair elastic,1-2 bobby pins, leather strand and hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 3 minutes

Degree of Difficulty: Easy

http://www.twitter.com/CuteGirlHair
http://www.pinterest.com/MrsHairdo
http://www.instagram/CuteGirlsHairstyles

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

Items Needed: Brush, one hair elastic, 3-4 Goody Spin Pins {if not, then 6-7 bobby pins}, curling iron {for pre-braid texture}, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement:  5+ minutes

I love the way that fishtail braids look, and have been wanting to a Fishtail braided bun for a long time!  Since this is prom season, we decided to finally film this hairstyle for all of you.

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHSideFishtailBun

If you do not know how to fishtail braid, please see our easy step-by-step video here first...
http://tinyurl.com/howtofishtail

Before the tutorial, I slightly curled the top layer of the hair only, using a curling wand, leaving the underneath layers as is.  I then gathered all of the hair to the side by the right ear and created the fishtail braid.

Once the braid was finished, I secured it with the hair elastic and tugged on the sides of the braid just to make the braid appear more loose.  Then I rolled the braid up into a bun and pinned it just behind the ear.  

To avoid having to use so many bobby pins, I used 3 Goody Spin Pins.  These pins are the perfect solution for holding hair buns together all day!  I figure that each spin pin saves you from having to use 2-3 bobby pins, and they come in colors to match your hair type.  If you would like to purchase Goody Spin Pins, you can find them at Wal-Mart, Target, Sally's, etc.  You can also find them on Amazon here... 

http://amzn.to/1Tck00N

This braided updo hairstyle is perfect for prom, homecoming, weddings, or on days when you simply want to wear a very unique, but cute, hair bun! I think it turned out very cute!

Enjoy!

FTC Disclosure:  This is not a paid review of the Goody¬Æ Spin Pin.  I purchased these myself and use them in my hair bun tutorials.  All opinions of the product are strictly mine, and results may vary.

videos.description:

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

TopStyler is offering a USD$49.99 special price {and free shipping to the US and Puerto Rico} on the TopStyler to our fans... this is a over a 50% discount!  They are also offering a discount on the InStyler as well! Here is the discount link: http://www.instyleroffer.com/topstyler

We uploaded our 1st version of the Katniss Braid several months before the movie came out.  Right after the movie premier, Linda Flowers, the lead hairstylist on The Hunger Games movie set, personally reached out to CuteGirlsHairstyles when she saw how popular our tutorial was!  Can you believe it... she reached out to US!!!

Linda was so amazed at how iconic the Katniss Braid became, so much that teen girls were wearing the braid to see the movie in theaters!  She recognized that CuteGirlsHairstyles helped in teaching thousands of our fans how to do the braid! As such, Linda offered to give me a "personal" tutorial of the many Hunger Games hairstyles over Skype!

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHTrueKatnissBraid

During our tutorial, I quickly saw that Katniss' style had a little more to it than what I had originally thought!  Linda showed me how she added the texture into Jennifer Lawrence's hair "before" she created the Katniss braid {something I had not figured out}.  She uses a tool called the TopStyler¬Æ {by InStyler¬Æ} to add volume and stranded twists into the diagonal Dutch braid.  I show you how to do this in the tutorial.

You can find the TopStyler at Target, Bed Bath & Beyond, Ulta, or online at the following link...

http://www.topstyler.com/

I appreciate that the TopStyler uses a slow and uniform transfer heat to curl the hair, rather than the immediate hot heat a curling wand provides that only heats the outside of the strand.

This is the exact look Katniss wore throughout the arena scenes in the movie, taught to CuteGirlsHairstyles personally by the one who created it... Linda Flowers!

Enjoy!

FTC Disclosure:  I was provided this TopStyler¬Æ tool free of charge by InStyler¬Æ for review purposes only.  No other forms of compensation were provided to CuteGirlsHairstyles.  All opinions of the product are strictly mine, and results may vary.

I am a BIG fan of messy braids, and now they are so popular... so we decided to give you a 5-Strand Messy Braid tutorial!

The stranding for this braid is a little complex, since you are using five strands instead of three, but once you get the hang of it - the braid will take very little time to create.

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHMessy5StrandBraid

If you do not know how to braid with 5 strands, make sure you are comfortable with a 3-strand braid first.  You can see our 3-Strand Messy Braid tutorial here...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QS7U-rZiub4

Watch carefully to see how we incorporate the other two strands, then, as we finish, we tie off the braid and then loosen the "elbows" of the braid.

When I walk around with this braided hairstyle, I receive so many compliments because it does not look like a regular braid.  Other girls want to know exactly how I did it.  I know you will get compliments, too!  

Items Needed: Brush, comb, ponytail holder, hairspray {if desired}

Time Required: 5 minutes

Hope you enjoy!

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

If you are like me you've noticed that everyone on TV, movies, magazines, or the internet are talking about the comeback of braids.  Everyone is wearing them and there are a million ways to wear them.

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHMessySideBraid

One of my very favorite braid hairstyles, is a small added flair to a simple braid... what everyone is calling a simple Messy Braid.  This is the perfect second day hairstyle {after curls the day prior} for a quick rush out the door.  

I've received so many emails asking for this tutorial.  I even had one fan ask over 10 friends to all email within a few hours each asking for this style!  Now, that is determination!  It definitely got my attention and I decided to make this our next tutorial.  

Items Needed: Brush, comb, ponytail holder, hairspray {if desired}

Time required: 2 minutes

Steps:
1.  Begin with dry slightly messy or curly hair.  {You can use a flat iron or wand to add a little curl to the top layer if needed}.  
2.  Pull all hair loosely to one side over your shoulder.
3.  Braid the hair using the regular braiding method.
4.  Tug on the elbows of the braid to loosen/flatten and soften the braid.
5.  Curl any loose pieces of hair to frame your face.  Remember it's supposed to be MESSY!  
6.  Bobby pin any problem strands into place.

Hope you enjoy!
